definition: to stand firm/to stand one's ground (in the face of adversity or pain)
straight/erect/to stick out (a part of the body)/to (physically) straighten up/to support/to withstand/outstanding/(coll.) quite/very/classifier for machine guns
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: Then came the words, “Hold on, we’re going to save you right now.”
sentences.chinese: 接着傳來了一句話，“挺住，我們很快過來救你。”

sentences.english: In this series, Boston couldn’t keep up.
sentences.chinese: 在這個系列賽中，凱爾特人沒能挺住。

sentences.english: Childern, I'm Grandfather Wenjiabao, just stick out and you must be saved.
sentences.chinese: 我是溫家寶爺爺，孩子們一定要挺住，一定會得救。

sentences.english: All the way to the hospital, I kept worrying about whether he was okay.
sentences.chinese: 去醫院的路上，我一直很擔心他能不能挺住。

definition: lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain/to bite the bullet
(idiom) a good person, used to praise sb's moral integrity or courage
to make oneself do sth in spite of adversity, pain etc
to bestir oneself/to pull oneself together/to cheer up/to uplift/to stimulate
(cry of encouragement)/to arise/to stand up/to gain the ascendancy/Come on!
win or lose, it all ends here/this is the moment to shine
pinyin: cheng2 bai4 zai4 ci3 yi1 ju3

definition: to brave it out/to the bitter end
to get better/to improve/to get well
